DiagnosticsExtended.CurlVersionCheckFailed: Matomo could not check if your cURL version has vulnerabilities.
DiagnosticsExtended.CurlVersionCheckNoCurl: Your PHP setup doesn't use cURL, so there is nothing to check.
DiagnosticsExtended.CurlVersionCheckUpToDate: Did not find any known vulnerabilities in your cURL version (%s).
DiagnosticsExtended.CurlVersionCheckVulnerable: Your cURL version (%s) might be vulnerable to these vulnerabilities (unless the distributor of your cURL binary is backporting security patches):
DiagnosticsExtended.DatabaseVersionCheckMariaDBEol: Your MariaDB version (%1$s) does not receive security support by the MariaDB team anymore (since %2$s). Install a newer version now.
DiagnosticsExtended.DatabaseVersionCheckMariaDBLatestVersion: You are using the latest version of MariaDB %s.
DiagnosticsExtended.DatabaseVersionCheckMariaDBNotEol: Your MariaDB version (%1$s) receives security support by the MariaDB team until %2$s.
DiagnosticsExtended.DatabaseVersionCheckMariaDBOutdated: There is a newer MariaDB patch version (%1$s) available (you are using %2$s/%3$s). Install it now.
DiagnosticsExtended.MatomoJSCheckFailedCurlTip: try running %s on your server and see if it is able to fetch the file
DiagnosticsExtended.MatomoJSCheckMIMEError: matomo.js should be delivered with an 'application/javascript' Content-Type. You are using '%s'.
DiagnosticsExtended.MatomoJSCheckNotGzipped: matomo.js is not delivered gzipped. You might want to set up gzip for .js files as it can reduce the size of the file by up to 60%.
DiagnosticsExtended.MatomoJSCheckUnknown: Matomo could not check if your matomo.js can be fetched properly.
DiagnosticsExtended.NotificationText: You have turned on the DiagnosticsExtended plugin. It adds a few more experimental system checks (marked with ðŸ§ª) to this page, helping you find issues with your Matomo instance. There might still be a few false positives and false negatives, so don't take the results as a truth, but check yourself if something is wrong. Please report issues with the plugin to the %1$sforum%2$s or %3$screate a GitHub issue%4$s so that the checks can be improved.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckInternedStrings: You have set opcache.interned_strings_buffer below 8 MB which might be a bit low. Please increase the value to 8 (Megabyte) or more depending on how many PHP files served and server memory available.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckJIT: Try turning on the JIT compiler to speed up Matomo since you are using PHP 8 or newer. Report back after turning on PHP JIT.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckMaxFiles: It seems like you have set opcache.max_accelerated_files to or below %s which might be too low to keep all Matomo files in the cache, especially if you are also hosting other PHP applications. Please set the option to 7963, 16229 or 32531 depending on the number of PHP files your webserver uses.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckMemory: You have set opcache.memory_consumption below 128 MB which might be too low to keep all Matomo files in the cache, especially if you are also hosting other PHP applications. Please increase the value to 128 or 256 (Megabyte) depending on PHP files served and server memory available.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckOpcacheDisabled: OPcache is turned off in your PHP setup. OPcache stores bytecode of PHP scripts in memory to speed up PHP by quite a bit (as it avoids loading and parsing PHP files on every request). Check the opcache.enable php.ini setting for more info.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckOpcacheEnabled: OPcache is turned on. %1$sMB of %2$sMB are used for PHP scripts (%3$s% wasted) and %4$sMB of %5$sMB are used for interned strings. %6$s% of requests hit the OPcache.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckSaveComments: It seems like you have turned off the opcache.save_comments setting. This removes comments from the OPcache making it smaller, but breaks Matomo. Please set opcache.save_comments to 0
DiagnosticsExtended.OpcacheCheckValidateTimestamps: You have turned off opcache.validate_timestamps, meaning PHP will never check if the actual files on disk have changed, but continue to use the cached ones. In theory, this should be no issue as Matomo invalidates the OPcache for updates and installs, but you might still want to look into this if you encounter weird issues.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpensslVersionCheckNoOpenssl: Your PHP setup doesn't use OpenSSL or cURL, so there is nothing to check.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpensslVersionCheckNotOutdated: Your OpenSSL version (%s) is not that old. Nevertheless, check if there are known vulnerabilities for it and install a new version if necessary.
DiagnosticsExtended.OpensslVersionCheckOutdated: Your OpenSSL version (%s) is quite old. Check if there are known vulnerabilities for it and install a new version it if necessary.
DiagnosticsExtended.PhpUserCheckWarning: Unless you are using Matomo inside a Docker container this should not be the case.
DiagnosticsExtended.PhpVersionCheckEol: Your PHP version (%1$s) does not receive security support by the PHP team anymore (since %2$s). Install a newer version.

DiagnosticsExtended.PhpVersionCheckNoInformation: There is no known info about your PHP version (%s)
DiagnosticsExtended.PhpVersionCheckNotEol: Your PHP version (%1$s) receives security support by the PHP team until %2$s.
DiagnosticsExtended.PhpVersionCheckNotWorking: Matomo could not check if your PHP version is up-to-date
DiagnosticsExtended.PhpVersionCheckOutdated: There is a newer PHP version (%1$s) available (you are using %2$s). Install it as soon as possible
